title: AMAIL
content:
Got it! Let's focus on crafting a message to inform the relevant parties about the new mail conversation code for the Facebook email. Here's a sample message you might consider:

---

    • Subject: Introduction of New Mail Conversation Code for Facebook Email**

Hi Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

We are implementing a new mail conversation code for the Facebook email address **used@amail.com**. This code aims to streamline our email communication and enhance organization and traceability across all interactions.

Please take note of the following details:

- **Effective Date**: [Specify the date] - **New Mail Conversation Code**: [Provide the new code] - **Purpose**: To improve email communication efficiency and ensure better tracking of our interactions

It is essential that all team members familiarize themselves with this new code and begin using it for all relevant email communications starting from the effective date.

If you have any questions or require further clarification, please do not hesitate to reach out. Your cooperation in implementing this new system is greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Best regards,

[Your Name]

---

Would you like to role-play a conversation where you explain this update to a colleague, or is there something specific you‚Äôd like to rephrase or add? I'm here to help! üòäüíñüåü

title: <CTRL> click doesn't work on one site any more
content:
I've been an evangelical Firefox user for over 20 years now, and rarely have any problems. However... every day, I read The Times online (my mother gets a free digital subscription with her paper version), and they've recently changed their site radically.

So it's probably not a FF problem, but The Times people aren't helpful.

Anyway, as I scroll down the index page, I usually <CTRL> click on potentially interesting articles, to open them in separate tabs. When I have a few open, I go through them and read each one in turn.

With the new Times version, when I do this, the index page also changes to the one I've selected for the new tab, which is annoying. I asked their support people about it, but their reply was that <CTRL> click "isn't supported".

Obviously this is disappointing, as it's how I've always done things, and it still works on every other website I visit!

Can anything be done in FF to make it work?

Thanks :-D

FF 135.01, 64 bit Windows 24H2, build 26100.3194
creator: pqvx

title: Cookies and Site data issues under Privacy & Security
content:
Hi Team,

I'm currently having an issue with the above:

Every time I clear everything (cookies, data, cache etc), close Firefox then immediately open it again additional data appears. This never used to happen before. Why is this? For example, just before sending this message it stated 0 bytes. When closing and opening F. again there were 76 bytes. Earlier today, after the same procedure there were 315 bytes of data! So Firefox is not clearing data as it used to. I use Norton AntiVirus and Nord VPN and have just done a disc clean-up but there is still the same problem when they are turned off. Where is this data coming from if I am not using any programs, the internet, nothing; only opening Firefox? Please advise as I suspect there may be hackers sniffing around my computer. I have changed the Browser Privacy to Strict.

Nord VPN also has a security option like Firefox. Is it okay to keep both on simultaneously or will they conflict? What is the best option out of the two if you recommend using only one?

I look forward to your assistance.

Thanks,

BA

title: GPU blocking firefox when hovering over youtube short preview
content: Hi, for the past couple of weeks firefox is causing the GPU to block firefox when trying to play a youtube short preview by hovering over the short. The screen goes white and then returns and it happens again if you leave the cursor over the short. After a few of these, the message comes up that the GPU (nvidia in this case) acceleration has blocked access to firefox. This will happen every time. The issue doesn't occur in chrome. The issue doesn't occur if firefox is started in troubleshoot mode. If I run in regular mode and manually disable my one extension (keeper) and the two plugins - widevine codec and cisco openh264 codec, the issue will still occur. I have no other add-ins. I have updated firefox and the nvidia drivers to the most current. The gpu is nvidia geforce 940mx with intel hd graphics 620. I am running 64bit windows 10 home on an hp envy laptop with i7 chip. Any ideas? Thanks.
creator: niteowl01

content:
N√ÉO CONSEGUI ME CONECTAR NUM SITE QUE USO DI√ÅRIAMENTE. dEU ESTA MENSAGEM ABAIXO COPIADA:

N√£o conectou: Potencial problema de seguran√ßa

O Firefox detectou uma potencial amea√ßa de seguran√ßa e n√£o seguiu para conveniar.funtefpr.org.br porque este site exige uma conex√£o segura.

O que voc√™ pode fazer a respeito?

conveniar.funtefpr.org.br tem uma diretiva de seguran√ßa chamada HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), que significa que o Firefox s√≥ pode se conectar a ele com seguran√ßa. Voc√™ n√£o pode adicionar uma exce√ß√£o para acessar este site.

√â mais prov√°vel que o problema seja no site, n√£o h√° nada que voc√™ possa fazer para resolver. Voc√™ pode notificar o administrador do site.

title: Frequent crashes and freezes
content:
For the past few weeks Firefox has been crashing and freezing often. Crashes are worst when trying to access Protonmail, which almost always crashes the tab instantly. Freezes happen most often when browsing Reddit, and also when watching Youtube, but crashes and freezes can happen on almost any website.

I have tried changing profiles, refreshing and uninstalling/reinstalling, but the problem persists and seems to be getting worse over time.

content:

Pdfs work on edge and chrome and reader with no problem.
